name: 討論與辯論（二）
description: 本課旨在訓練培養學生參與英語討論及辯論的口語能力。在辯論部分，學生將學習基本批判思考、論點陳述、相互提問與反駁回應技巧，並熟悉相關言談特色。課程進行方式主要為全班或小組討論與簡易論辯練習為主。在討論部分，學生將藉由討論方式，探討不同國內外議題，並嘗試參與不同類型之小組討論。學習評量包含學生個人及所屬小組之課堂表現及課前準備，同組組員亦將彼此互評各組員之貢獻。
goals: Acquire the knowledge of different debate propositions and the ability to word a debate proposition properly.
Learn about the format and structure for cross-examination debate.
Acquire the knowledge of affirmative and negative case strategies.
Acquire the skills to ask and respond to questions during cross-examination.
Apply the knowledge and skills concerning critical thinking and argumentative discourse to making and responding to arguments in English.
Learn the importance and essential skills of teamwork.
Learn about different types of formal discussion.
10.　Acquire the knowledge of dynamics of small-group discussion.
11.　Learn the skills entailed in being a good discussant.
12.　Learn the skills entailed in being a competent moderator.
13.　Acquire the ability to evaluate the discussant’s and the moderator’s performances as well as the discussion as a whole.
syllabus:
**Senior English Majors - Discussion - Spring 2019**

**Objectives**:  Learning discussion helps students develop their reasoning and communication skills. It encourages collaborative thinking and attunes students to a multiplicity of viewpoints and perspectives. Above all, discussion can help students gain confidence in their intellectual abilities and learn how to evaluate a theory or synthesize ideas. During this course, as well as learning some essential argumentative discourse skills, students will learn the purpose of discussion, the roles of discussants, and the ways of planning, participating in and evaluating different types of discussion. The various reading materials are presented through a very brief lecture from the instructor followed by a variety of student group workshops. Students will also be asked to make regular contributions to the class Facebook/Moodle page, and will be evaluated for their individual and teamwork performances especially their contributions to the two major task group assignments.

**Textbook:** Chang, Shau-ju **(2016).** English Debate and Argumentation Made Easy for Chinese EFL Learners. **2nd Ed.** Taipei: Crane Publishing.

**Online:** NTNU Discussion Class on Facebook/Moodle

**Materials**: A notebook for taking in-class notes, for homework, and for submitting discussion/debate drafts and transcripts.

**Guidelines and Requirements: The Rules!**

4.  **Homework** and assignments **must** **be done on time.**
5.  You are expected to actively participate on **Facebook NTNU Discussion Class.**
